page.title: 19BIRD WATCHING.
page.content: When I was out with my group doing the land cover survey on our square I was very excited to see a curlew. It flew over head for over ten minutes and was still there when we moved on.My hobbies are bird watching and belonging to Cubs.The curlew was the first I had seen.We think it must have had a nest close by.We moved away so that we wouldn't disturb it.Last year in a neighbouring field Ifound a lapwing's nest.Both these birds like to nest near water and there is a stream at the bottom of the fields. Most of the birds I have seen are very common, but last winter we did have a redshank in our garden.We also see a little owl quite often in the garden. At school we have a bird table and we feed the birds in winter, but we haven't had any rare visitors.
